dt: {bc}attracting or seeking to attract attention, admiration, or envy often by gaudiness or obviousness {bc}overly elaborate or conspicuous {bc}characterized by, fond of, or evincing {d_link|ostentation|ostentation}

dt.t: The power of the government was present … but it did not express itself in large and {wi}ostentatious{/wi} buildings.

pt: {sc}showy{/sc} {sc}pretentious{/sc} {sc}ostentatious{/sc} mean given to excessive outward display. {sc}showy{/sc} implies an imposing or striking appearance but usually suggests cheapness or poor taste.
{sc}pretentious{/sc} implies an appearance of importance not justified by the thing's value or the person's standing.

pt.t: the {it}ostentatious{/it} summer homes of the rich

quotes.t: That pompous excuse for a plush ride is a thumb in the eye to every taxpayer—and in the case of an {qword}ostentatious{/qword} cost-cutter, genuine hypocrisy.
Always proud to sit down with an ice-cold beer in my hand, I was {qword}ostentatious{/qword} about it in town.
She had driven to Prague from the Netherlands in her Porsche, telling friends she didn't give a hoot how {qword}ostentatious{/qword} she might appear to the comrades.

shortdef: attracting or seeking to attract attention, admiration, or envy often by gaudiness or obviousness : overly elaborate or conspicuous : characterized by, fond of, or evincing ostentation
